result.execSummary:
The defendant Tremain L Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all of following by end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
All applicable fees of supervision.
*Restitution set at zero.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving two (2) years of incarceration.

superMiscConds.notes:
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No alcohol or drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
No possession of drug paraphernalia.
No contact with any victims,  Little Whiskey Bar,  codefendants or the Black Disciples gang.
AODA assesssment. Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court orders no other specific programming conditions. Defendant must complete a Risk and Needs Assessment with DOC.  Comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identifed.

Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Certification of SENTENCING transcript commencing 09-28-2015 received and filed. (29 Pages.)  CH

Defendant Tremain L Jones in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Tremain L Jones in custody.  Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant is ordered to provide a DNA sample.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  7 YEARS with 158 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.
Court finds defendant IS  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program after serving 2 years of incarceration
Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol. No possession of drug paraphernalia.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Obtain GED/HSED
- No contact with:  any victims, Little Whiskey Bar, co-defendants or the Black Disciples gang
- Provide a DNA sample.
Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk & needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of zero; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Tremain L Jones in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Tremain L Jones in custody.  Ron Dague appeared for Patrick Anderson for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  On Court's own motion Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Tremain L Jones not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tremain L Jones in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Tremain L Jones in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense wishes to be heard on bail.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIES the defense motion for bail reduction.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Tremain L Jones not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum for Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for bail review.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIES defense motion for bail reduction.  Court GRANTS state's motion to add DRUG TESTING to Justice Point conditions.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22 for scheduling conference on 05/27/2015 at 8:30am.

Defendant Tremain L Jones in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Tremain L Jones in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO REDUCE BAIL.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Gregg W.; Little Whiskey Bar; April K.; Cheryl K. or their residences or Co-Defendant Patrick Lewis

Defendant Tremain L Jones in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Tremain L Jones in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
